hey... we use junit a lot now where i work, and it's damned nice knowing 
that you didn't break things before you check your code in. we did have one 
feature request idea... it would be spiffy if you could attach comments / 
explanations to tests.

one of our suite()s might look like this:
--
public static Test suite()  // {{{
{
    TestSuite suite= new TestSuite( WarehouseTest.class.getName() );

    // user tests
    suite.addTest( new WarehouseTest( "testGetMissingUser" ) );
--etc etc

we were thinking it would be neat if you could add an explanation comment to 
the methods (to give them more semantic meaning):

--
public static Test suite()  // {{{
{
    TestSuite suite= new TestSuite( WarehouseTest.class.getName() );

    // user tests
    suite.addTest( new WarehouseTest( "testGetMissingUser" ),
     "This test guarantees when we attempt to get a user who isn't there, we 
recieve the proper error message." );
--

basically, there would just be another addTest() method, that took in a Test 
and a String explaining the test. it could default to "no explanation given" 
if it's unspecified.

where it might be useful: as you're running through the tests, the swingui 
test runner could display them with the names of the tests in a seperate 
text field, or maybe it would show up as a "tooltip" type thing when you 
hover over the test, etc etc. either way, it might help in situations when 
the person running the test is not the person who wrote the test in the 
first place (which is going to be the case most of the time). oh, and when 
you're running tests for clients, to prove "this is why we're billing hours 
for testing", it would be neat to show off.

now, to some extent you can do this with javadoc (which we do) and with long 
test names like testProgressReportChangeEnrollmentTerminateStatus (which we 
also do). but this would certainly be cool.

my knowledge of swing is just about 0, but i might be willing to take a 
crack at TestSuite perhaps?

let me know what you think... it's only an idea :)

john
